title: WWII Events Quiz
description: How well do you remember the key events of World War II?

questions.question: On what date did Japan attack Pearl Harbor?
questions.explanation: Japan attacked the US naval base at Pearl Harbor, Hawaii on December 7, 1941, bringing the United States into World War II.

questions.question: What was the code name for the Allied invasion of Normandy on June 6, 1944?
questions.explanation: Operation Overlord was the code name for the D-Day landings on the beaches of Normandy, France, the largest amphibious invasion in history.

questions.question: Which battle is considered the turning point of WWII on the Eastern Front?
questions.explanation: The Battle of Stalingrad (1942-1943) was a devastating defeat for Nazi Germany and is widely regarded as the turning point on the Eastern Front.

questions.question: What was the name of the first atomic bomb dropped on Hiroshima?
questions.explanation: The atomic bomb 'Little Boy' was dropped on Hiroshima, Japan on August 6, 1945. 'Fat Man' was dropped on Nagasaki three days later.

questions.question: In what year did Germany invade Poland, starting World War II in Europe?
questions.explanation: Germany invaded Poland on September 1, 1939, prompting Britain and France to declare war on Germany two days later.

questions.question: What was the evacuation of Allied soldiers from the beaches of Dunkirk known as?
questions.explanation: Operation Dynamo evacuated over 338,000 Allied soldiers from the beaches of Dunkirk, France in May-June 1940.

questions.question: Which conference in 1945 divided post-war Germany into occupation zones?
questions.explanation: The Potsdam Conference (July-August 1945) established the post-war order in Europe, including the division of Germany into four occupation zones.

questions.question: What was Germany's failed invasion of the Soviet Union called?
questions.explanation: Operation Barbarossa was launched on June 22, 1941, when Nazi Germany invaded the Soviet Union in the largest military operation in history.

questions.question: On what date did Germany officially surrender, ending WWII in Europe?
questions.explanation: Germany surrendered unconditionally on May 8, 1945, known as V-E Day (Victory in Europe Day).

questions.question: Which Pacific island battle raised the famous flag on Mount Suribachi?
questions.explanation: The iconic flag-raising photograph was taken on Mount Suribachi during the Battle of Iwo Jima in February 1945.

questions.question: What was the Nazi plan to systematically murder European Jews called?
questions.explanation: The 'Final Solution' (Endlösung) was the Nazi plan for the genocide of the Jewish people, resulting in the Holocaust and the murder of six million Jews.

questions.question: Which naval battle in June 1942 is considered the turning point of the Pacific War?
questions.explanation: The Battle of Midway (June 1942) was a decisive American victory that destroyed four Japanese aircraft carriers and shifted the balance of power in the Pacific.

questions.question: What was the massive German air campaign against Britain in 1940-1941 called?
questions.explanation: The Blitz was the sustained German bombing campaign against the United Kingdom from September 1940 to May 1941, targeting London and other major cities.

questions.question: Which 1943 Allied invasion of Italy began with landings on this island?
questions.explanation: Operation Husky, the Allied invasion of Sicily in July 1943, marked the beginning of the Italian Campaign and led to the fall of Mussolini.

questions.question: What was the last major German offensive on the Western Front called?
questions.explanation: The Battle of the Bulge (December 1944 - January 1945) was Germany's last major offensive, fought through the dense forests of the Ardennes region.
